website_summaries.verdict: These diaper liners aren't quite as soft as some others out there, but they're sturdy enough to survive a few washes and soften up somewhat in the process.
pros: Helps skin stay a little drier between changes
Natural viscose construction is biodegradable and flushable
Strong enough to endure a handful of washes after liquid-only messes
Stays a bit drier than softer varieties
cons: Activity can cause them to bunch up

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Poop Liner
customer_reviews.text: The best I've found. You can wash the 'pee-only' ones and completely reuse a few times until they wear out. I do not flush them! Because I can actually wash and reuse, I assume they don't break down as easy as a septic system would need. Tips for washing - wash in a garment bag so keep them away from the velcro parts of your cloth diapers. Lay flat to dry. Drying them in a dryer will cause them to shrink a little (but not bad).
customer_reviews.author: LACbuyer

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been cloth diapering for 7+ years, and I can’t believe I never tried these liners! I’ve used various other brands, and their liners are just okay. They got mishapen every time my son would pee. But these liners don’t move or bunch up. So durable and effective. We love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: We use cloth diapers and everything was going smoothly until we started feeding my son solids. This new change threw a wrench in our wash routine until we ordered these liners. They are a nice size and are simple to use. We actually are able to wash and reuse the liners he only pees on with the rest of his diapers so they are very cost efficient. The ease of cleanup is well worth the cost, as I am not interested in a diaper sprayer or any of the other methods.
customer_reviews.author: The Finkledinks

customer_reviews.title: At first I was disappointed that they didn't fit my diaper system
customer_reviews.text: These are not quite big enough to snap into my Tidy Tots diapers, but they still work well and can even survive a wash if you're looking to reuse once. At first I was disappointed that they didn't fit my diaper system, but it has worked out because I can flush them without unsnapping them from the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn of All Trades

customer_reviews.title: Good perforation, more paper-like
customer_reviews.text: I still prefer the Bumkins liners of all the liners I've tried. They are a bit more "clingy" to stick to the diaper a bit. These are great if you don't like lint on baby's bottom, but I find them hard to keep in place on the diaper due to being a little more paper-like/slippery than other liners I've used.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Juart

customer_reviews.title: Really strong and holds up..
customer_reviews.text: Use these to protect the bamboo padding from # 2 accidents. The one time we didn't put it in is when it happened (the ironey right!) but so far they are quite sturdy i havent wash and resused one onlt time i would is if there wasnt a pee accident the day before.. But if he does have a pee accident I'd throw it away for my personal sanitary choice. But the feel of them aren't rough at all they feel like breathable strong tissue with a smooth finish..
customer_reviews.author: Kisrael

customer_reviews.title: not rough like other brands
customer_reviews.text: We've used all sorts of diaper liners ordered from Amazon over the years (we have two kids under 3). Generally, we order whatever is cheapest, because these liners are a one-time use for the cloth diapers. That was until we found OsoCozy. These liners are amazingly soft, not rough like other brands. They also seem to be a bit more absorbant. It's a nice positive when cloth diapers last like 5 minutes on a baby.
customer_reviews.author: wrygurl

customer_reviews.title: Great for catching solid waste
customer_reviews.text: These have made our cloth diapering journey much easier. I purchased these once my daughter started solids already so her waste was a bit more solid. They have been great and catch all the solid waste so I don't have to spend forever trying to rinse the diaper in the toilet as we dont have a sprayer. They only work for solid waste so I wouldn't use them for younger babies with looser stool. We throw our liners away after each use instead of flushing them since it can clog septic tanks. They feel like a dryer sheet but they don't seem to bother my daughter. I'll be ordering more soon.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried these because they were cheaper than the Munchybaby liners we were using and because the reviews were good. Well we are three days in and even though these are larger, they bunch up more. When they do stay put they don't keep the diaper as clean as the other liners. There were a lot of times that I didn't have to use the sprayer with the other liners. That hasn't happened with these so far. We will use these as backups. They are not bad, I've just found something that works better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stillinschool

customer_reviews.title: Not sure I see the point of these
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I don't see the point in these. The cloth diapers still get super stained. I am trying this out for cloth diapering my 3 month old that I breastfeed. I was hoping it would help cut down on staining. No. Perhaps it is meant for dirtier more solid diapers of a toddler. So i will update the review once we get there. Also, it says on the package don't flush for septic systems. Or soak it before flushing. Which is the extra work these were supposed to alleviate.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Q

customer_reviews.title: Works as it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Use this on top of both my pockets and prefolds. It doesnt feel flimsy and doesnt rip when I tear a sheet off. My baby has extremely sensitive skin but so far this hasnt seemed to bother him, which is a great plus! I havent tried washing them like others on here have, but I feel like maybe one handwash and hang dry wouldnt cause it to fall apart if that's something you want to do. I also dont flush these, just throw any solids in the toilet and then put it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these liners!
customer_reviews.text: We love cloth diapers in my house! We have used a lot of different brands and types. I didn't really feel the need for a liner until my son started solid foods. His baby poop went to grown man poop rather quickly and it was gross. The liners worked great for us! They didn't cuase any issues with our toilet or septic system and they were very easy to use. I absolutely loved these when we started solid foods!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: 50% success rate
customer_reviews.text: These help catch the doodoo about half the time. The other half they are bunched up in one spot and the poo is still everywhere. I'm going to try making my own liners out of fleece instead of using these.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Washable!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands of this style of diaper liners over the years. Osocozy brand works really well and is a generous size. As an added bonus, I just discovered (accidentally, but much to my delight) that they hold up really well on at least one trip through the washer! So I'll be getting double the amount of uses! Other brands I've used in the past definitely did not survive any accidental washes.
customer_reviews.author: Laticia H

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without them
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't cloth diaper my older kiddo without these! They keep most of the mess in the liner leaving behind minimal cleanup which is great! Will definitely order again!
customer_reviews.author: Vfresta

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'm particularly fond of these liners. They are somewhat stiff, like an unused dryer sheet. When placed in a cloth diaper, they tend to shift and poke out of the leg holes, which will wick pee out of the diaper if unnoticed. They are also not the best at keeping substances off the diapers, as some amount of rash cream can pass through.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: If you are cloth diapering for an older baby, you need these! I was debating purchasing a sprayer attachment for my toilet but was afraid of spraying poop all over the bathroom. These sheets are great! Very durable and they hold solids well. Love that they are generous in size so that they collect all the yuckiness.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Bradon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t let liquid through to the diaper.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used a few types of liners with our cloth diapers, and these are the first that had issues letting liquid through. We’ve had a massive increase in leakage since using these liners. They also tend to bunch up a lot as our child wiggles about making them less effective at catching solids. They are still usable, but not nearly as good as other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M Takoch

customer_reviews.title: They shred before you can even get them in the diaper
customer_reviews.text: These are HORRIBLE. We have been using them for 2 years and LOVED them up until this last roll that we bought. They used to be perfect and easy to pull off of the roll. Now they shred when you try to tear them apart from one another. You also used to be able to wash and reuse the pee ones but now they just shred. Not sure if we got a bad batch or if they changed their manufacturing but I am SO annoyed and will be asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Decent liner but seems to bunch up more than other brands.
customer_reviews.text: These liners are decent. They do their job but I'm holding back one star since they seem to bunch up more than other brands I've tried. Since they are a little stiffer than other brands they don't seem to move with the child's movements and often end up bunched in the front or back of the diaper. They still make clean up easier but not as much as if they stayed directly under babies bottom. Bumpkins liners seem to work better for us as they tend to bunch up less.
customer_reviews.author: Intrepid Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great durability
customer_reviews.text: These liners were great for our cloth baby while she was transitioning to pureed foods. What I liked most was the liners lasted through the washing machine. If #2 happened we tossed the liner in the toilet, but for #1 we just threw the whole diaper in the dirty bag and sent it through the wash. So it was cleaned just like everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: These didn’t keep the poo off of the diaper. It would seep through. Which defeats the whole purpose of using them. Also NOT flushable as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Meh not overly impressed
customer_reviews.text: These work well but I'm not sure how good they are to flush they hold up through accidental washings and dissolve or anything. Makes me wonder if they just build up in the pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: This liners produced a rash to my baby. Just use 2 sheets! Its soft, easy to clean (just discard the used ones)
customer_reviews.author: Juan Jarmar Mota

customer_reviews.title: Gave my toddler a rash
customer_reviews.text: These gave my daughter a rash, probably since she's an active 22 month old, with it being dry and rubbing against her. Rash showed up in the evening the first day she wore it, took it off the next day and it was gone. Happened with my kid, may not happen with others...
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diaper MUST
customer_reviews.text: These are a cloth diaper must once you get to the solid food stage! I’ve sometimes thrown them in the washer (if they weren’t used for poop) to use again (they get much softer this way). We never put on a diaper without one of these liners. If you position them correctly, they peel right out and easily flush.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Helps catch the #2 to easily flush however sometimes when tearing it out is difficult. More so then other brands I’ve tried
customer_reviews.author: ngoc bui

customer_reviews.title: Not septic safe
customer_reviews.text: It says on the website that these are flushable for septic systems but on the package it says that are not septic safe... very disappointed, i would give 0 stars if i could
customer_reviews.author: Zach Taylor

customer_reviews.title: First use was already worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip away for the weekend. I have a sprayer at home. Away I wouldn't have the same amenities. The first diaper and it serves its purpose! It was so easy to clean up and I can store dirty diapers without the mess to travel home. Did not irritate my son's skin at all. So glad we got these for vacations or time away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy!
customer_reviews.text: V poor quality. Harsh on baby's bum. Dint work out for us. Would not recommmmend.
customer_reviews.author: Pooja

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to cloth diaper
customer_reviews.text: These make cloth diapering easy! We use them in every diaper and wash the ones that don’t get soiled along with our diapers and pull them to air dry for a second use. Very rarely do they shift or not catch the mess they are supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Love these as they allow liquid to pass through and catch the solids. They stay in place and don’t absorb liquid so they don’t keep her wet. Not the softest thing but I’m overall very happy and will Continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Young

customer_reviews.title: Easy to ise
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used other liners before which were def softer but these aren’t bad.
customer_reviews.author: PSingh

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: These cloth diaper liners make clean up so much better! I would say it is a must have for any parent considering using cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Look

customer_reviews.title: These hold up for re-use multiple times!
customer_reviews.text: OsocCozy liners work great! The peed on liners can be washed and reused(air dry) SEVERAL TIMES. I tried the Bumkins liners first because of their good reviews, but I was kind of let down- Bumkins are definitely one-time use liners. The peed liners cannot be reused and disintegrate quickly, leaving gaping holes in the liners and distorting the shape of the liner as well. OsoCozy is bigger(catches the poo!) AND stays together, making it a great bargain if you are looking for a disposable liner. One roll of 100 is going to last just as long as 4 Bumkins 100ct. boxes or more! Save some $$$ and buy these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go use.
customer_reviews.text: Specifically we put these in our cloth diapers when we were on the go. It made changaing and cleaning up a poo diaper in public so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: especially helpful for grandma or a sitter that may not be comfortable sticking their hand in the toilet to clean a soiled cloth
customer_reviews.text: These were great except like other reviewers have stated...we lived in an older home and it clogged up our sewer drain that headed to the street. But if you live in a newer home, these are awesome and especially helpful for grandma or a sitter that may not be comfortable sticking their hand in the toilet to clean a soiled cloth diaper,.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: NOT Septic Safe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the title says "Flushable"........not if you have a septic tank...NOT septic safe... If a bit of them pokes out of the diaper prepare for a leak because these things wick the moisture away...down the side of a leg if you're not careful. Waste of money for these reasons. Bought a different product that I'm much happier with.
customer_reviews.author: Christine D.

customer_reviews.title: They're nice, they work
customer_reviews.text: They're nice, they work, they are softer than the other lines I choose (not enough to make me switch to these), but I can't beat the price of the other brand. Twice as much for only $2. I did not experience any issues with the plumbing but I did stop using these after 1 roll. The other brand I've been through 3 rolls over 4 months and I've not had one issue. Our plumbing is not new.
customer_reviews.author: SBK479

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried any other liners but I have no complaints about these ones. They are large but I think that's the point, to be able to catch all the poo, right? Non irritating for the baby bum and yet sturdy enough to catch the solid stuff while allowing the liquid to pass through. No leaks or any other issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not flushable. Total greenwashed.
customer_reviews.text: This product claims to be flushable, but it is not. Do not flush these down your toilet. We are now dealing with a deep clog after using these for the last couple months. Furthermore, viscose rayon is not en environmentally friendly material. The material is sourced from renewable sources (such as wood pulp), but consider all the chemicals and energy used throughout the process. We should have done more research before we bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Makes cloth diapering so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I use these with my cloth diapers and it makes them SO much more manageable.
customer_reviews.author: BLR

customer_reviews.title: Reusable!
customer_reviews.text: These do the job, and can go through the wash without dissolving. I like that I can get more than one use out of pee only liners. I tried the Bummis liners, and they dissolved in our wash...so I didn't expect these to hold up so well! I kind of like them better after they've been through the wash too, as they get softer. They aren't horrible off the roll, but they aren't the softest either.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect union of soft yet durable
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few other liners (GroVia, and Bummies) but these are a good cross between the two. The Bummies are really soft compared to the ultra-stuff GroVia but they don't wash we'll so using them again is a pain. The GroVia wash we'll buy they're stiff. But the OsoCozy fits right in between. Soft like the Bummies, but stand up to being washed and reused like the GroVia. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't love these, I tend to use this type of liner as wipes too and these were just not great for that, and they always bunched up in my sons diaper so they ended up not serving their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Herrick

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Other brands are much softer and more comfortable for baby in my opinion but these work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Yoder

customer_reviews.title: The baby's room doesn't smell like poo!
customer_reviews.text: I love these liners! Wish I had used these from the start. They are big enough to catch all the poo and easy to use. It's great to be able to flush to poo and not have it in my washing machine or sitting in the diaper pail all day smelling up the house. I like that all the liquid passes through, and what's left is a dry poo. Less sticks to the baby's bottom so there is less to wipe and he doesn't get disper rash as often anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tamarah

customer_reviews.title: Skip the liner. Too big and moves around too much
customer_reviews.text: Moves around a lot. Large. Thought these would make traveling with cloth easier, but rather osore cumbersome. Skip the liner is my recommendation
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact it came on a roll and was ...
customer_reviews.text: They did the job, but they were not long enough to cover the entire diaper seat. The thin material is probably meant to make the liners flushable, but it was too thin and defeated the purpose when lining a poop diaper. I love the fact it came on a roll and was sold at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.SkyHy

customer_reviews.title: works but rough
customer_reviews.text: these work. however, they are rough. the roughness irritated my baby's skin.
customer_reviews.author: ew

customer_reviews.title: nope!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these! They are so rigid and I do not want to flush them since I'm afraid that one flushed will clog up the toilet. I will not buy these again and wish I hasn't in the first place. This brand is on my don't buy again list.
customer_reviews.author: froggys109

customer_reviews.title: Better than folded
customer_reviews.text: We switched to these after using up two boxes of the folded liners. These are much more convenient. Pulling off a sheet from a roll is easy to do with one hand, as opposed to pulling out a sheet, unfolding it, and putting it in the diaper. Both seem to work fine as a diaper liner. I wouldn't recommend flushing any liner down the toilet though.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Dad

customer_reviews.title: Lifesavers !
customer_reviews.text: More like diaper savers. These make cloth diaper much more convient and clean. Less mess and staining on inserts. Would not cloth diaper with out them. I wash and reuse Them if they were only peed on.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Boris

customer_reviews.title: Hold up compared to other liners
customer_reviews.text: Great size, hold up well. They are definitely one our favorites after we've tried many brands. We can even throw them in the wash once or twice! Grovia and bumpkins were too flimsy--being peed on disintegrated them so they didn't hold the poop as well.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great flushable liners. If they are just wet I throw them in the wet bag with the soiled diapers and they wash up beautifully and they last a little longer if you air dry them. I reuse them until they need to be flushed. I've tried others that are cheaper, but they're not nearly as soft as these, and some even fall apart in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P

customer_reviews.title: I liked them...
customer_reviews.text: I like them. They were soft and wide but the poop stained the diapers and the pee almost made them dissolve.
customer_reviews.author: fatima apontes

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried flushing I am afraid I’ll clog the toilet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always gave my son blowouts
customer_reviews.text: I feel like these liners just funneled poop towards the legs of my son's cloth diaper. We never have blowouts and had them no matter how I positioned or tweaked these. We'll just stick with spraying off poop.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Reduces the Mess!
customer_reviews.text: We are currently EBF, so I'm anxious to see how these do when we start solids. Be aware that EBF waste is very thin and these aren't going to catch it all, but they do reduce cleanup. I also have had success with washing them with my cloth diapers when baby has a wet diaper only and using them a 2nd time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Gold medalist of liners
customer_reviews.text: Tested several types and I find these easiest to use, most effective, gentlest on the butt, and easiest to reuse which is a huge plus. Highly recommend over the other liners.
customer_reviews.author: pru_corner

customer_reviews.title: you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.text: works great at keeping the yuckies off the cloth diapers. we've used several different brands and right now, this is the best one for the quality and money
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Rashes
customer_reviews.text: These liners keep giving my infant a rash. Really bad rashes that breaks the skin. I do not recommend these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Myeisha Woodley

customer_reviews.title: Go to brand for liners!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other brands and the competitors felt too thin and the length was right. This however work amazing I love these even my wife noticed that I had bought a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: richardx

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the amount that are in each roll!
customer_reviews.text: Cloth diaper Mom second time around, these are still my favorite liners to use for easy clean up and my little one goes #2
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Work perfectly for our needs
customer_reviews.text: I love these liners; they've made a huge difference in our washing-out-the-diaper lives!! They hold up well (we have re-used, for example if we change a diaper before baby poos) and hold what they need to hold well. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Lee Lee Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Best I've tried
customer_reviews.text: These are the best brand I have tried of this product. They are strong but still flexible. Unlike other brands that are strong but don't adjust to the contours of the diaper, these conform easily to whatever space is available inside the diaper. They also wash well and can be reused multiple times if not soiled. And the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Good liners
customer_reviews.text: These liners save our diaper from baby poop! So easy to take of the diaper and through away in the trash with the poop on it. Then just wash your diapers like you normally do. I usually soak all dirty diapers right away and then wash them in the laundry.
customer_reviews.author: krolik123

customer_reviews.title: Came fast, and does as described. If you ...
customer_reviews.text: Came fast, and does as described. If you are dedicated to saving money and reducing land fills cloth diapers are for you. These flushable inserts help remove the "solids" from the actual diaper and reduce the mess that it involves.
customer_reviews.author: just a reader

customer_reviews.title: and they are a great size!
customer_reviews.text: MUCH softer than other brands we have used, and they are a great size!
customer_reviews.author: Amy ricca

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best liner I've used. They are big (wider than my ALVA diapers), but it's very thin material so the poop seeps through the liner, so I still have to rinse out the diaper. Will be trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Montoy

customer_reviews.title: There is better liners out there
customer_reviews.text: It does what I was looking for. I was looking for a liner to help protect my diapers and make them easier to clean. There is better liners out there, but for the price this one works. It is very thin, but it doesn't irritate my baby bum. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: steph Boubou

customer_reviews.title: Just too Awesome☺☺
customer_reviews.text: Best thing to use in cloth diapers. Easy to knock poop off into the toilet and flush. This makes cloth diapering so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: CYCI

customer_reviews.title: bunched up! not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: these liners punched up and I still had to clean the mess on the diaper. I bought them because they were cheaper than another band. but they did not work.
customer_reviews.author: green mom

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine but wish it came with some sort of dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G. Seale

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but missing perforations
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I waited so long to get Inserts. These are great at holding poo and keeping diaper laundry easier. My only complaint is that the perforations stop about an inch below the bottom and it causes them to rip unless I am super careful.
customer_reviews.author: nikb18

customer_reviews.title: I love these. If no poop
customer_reviews.text: I love these. If no poop, I can wash and reuse 2+ times (so one roll lasts a few months). When there is poop, 90% of the time it's fully contained on the liner. Wish I had used these with my first kid!
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Not Loving Them
customer_reviews.text: I normally use Bummies brand but tried these while Bummies were out of stock. Not a fan of these. They slide around in the diaper and the poop doesn't stick to them so it makes a huge mess inside the diaper. Completely defeats the purpose of having a liner.
customer_reviews.author: lexiee

customer_reviews.title: Dont use a spatula
customer_reviews.text: These do the job, but they are very wide and long so I have to tuck them in. Worth it for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: I get a lot of use out of them for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love these because they hold up in the wash. The point of them is to catch number two so I toss them in with my diapers if there was only a number one. Other brands I have tried fall apart after one wash.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life so much easier
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and makes cleaning up poo 10x easier no need to spray the diaper just flush the liner with the poo down the toilet. With only wet diapers I throw the liners in the pail and re-use them once or twice
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N. Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Read the Label
customer_reviews.text: They say "flushable" but the label recommends only flushing them if they are soiled. If they're just wet toss them in the trash, or they can cause plumbing problems.
customer_reviews.author: H. Family

customer_reviews.title: but these are way better. The material is pretty stay dry
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Bummi's liners, but these are way better. The material is pretty stay dry, which is great for my rash prone daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Dandieandie

customer_reviews.title: High quality and soft
customer_reviews.text: These let urine through nicely and are soft. The GroVia liners don't let urine through well, and hence it leaks out of the gussets often.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gihring

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I don't love them. They are not soft and rarely stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: peacefulbasha19

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I wash them with my diapers when there ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I wash them with my diapers when there has only been a "#1" and they hold up great.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kenedy

customer_reviews.title: These make cloth diapering so much easier! They are ...
customer_reviews.text: These make cloth diapering so much easier! They are quite a bit softer than some other diaper liner brands we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Katie O. Magi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best, softest, and easiest to wash and reuse diaper liners that I've tried! I'm obsessed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Rose

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome liners for use with cloth diapers. They're easy to use and work well!
customer_reviews.author: Jen B.

customer_reviews.title: Great except for one thing...
customer_reviews.text: These worked great, and they held up well if you washed them (if the diaper was just wet, not dirty). The only complaint was that they didn't rip apart well. I had to be very carful when tearing apart or they would rip where they weren't supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: EAG

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: These make cloth diapering so much easier! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Yantes

customer_reviews.title: These are great! I cut them in half
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I cut them in half, wash the "wet only" ones to reuse (don't put them in the dryer!) and have had great success! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to separate the sheets
customer_reviews.text: We've used one other brand and thought we'd try something different here. We've found it almost impossible to get a clean tear on any sheet no matter how carefully we try. That means we end up with lots of sheets shredded or torn in half, and thus, wasted. It's kind of like those big rolls of clear packing tape that you lose the end to and as you try to peel it up you end up with shredded tape. They work well, but I would not purchase them again, especially when there are other brands that separate just fine for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diapering convenience at a cost
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but overpriced considering it's a basically woven paper to hold poop....
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: decent liners
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were a bit thicker, but they're thicker than the last brand I tried, GroVia, I think.
customer_reviews.author: littlespender

customer_reviews.title: Time and Mess Savers!
customer_reviews.text: They work just as the other reviews say. I've washed some of them a few times now and they are good as new! They have been a big time and mess saver with cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Work great, but a weird size
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I would mark down is because of the weird size. The are 8 inches wide. So you have to scrunch or fold them to keep them from sticking out. However, they do seem to work better than the kushies ones someone had given me as a gift. They are also softer. They don't completely rid the mess, but that's not the point in my opinion. They make it much easier to plop the nasties into the toilet. I still use my sprayer, but it's much easier! I would repurchase these if I decide to continue using liners.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Little too wide
customer_reviews.text: A little too wide for a pocket diaper. Otherwise they do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey K

customer_reviews.title: My favorite liners
customer_reviews.text: Great quality liners! I can wash and reuse the ones that haven't been pooped on. They catch most of the poo and make using cloth diapers much easier.
customer_reviews.author: impaz0330

customer_reviews.title: kinda large
customer_reviews.text: the sheets are big, so for my baby at least (7 months) you have to do some quick folding or tucking to get it to not hang out the sides or the back and still cover the important parts of the diaper. It is possible that when my baby is bigger, and the inside of the diaper is bigger it will be a perfect size, but for now we have to fold it with a wiggly baby sometimes this can be difficult. They do protect the diaper just fine and don't break down immediately when they get wet which is nice, and so far we haven't had any plumbing issues, so their being flush-able seems to be correct.
customer_reviews.author: a. person

customer_reviews.title: Makes diapers easier
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to clean up poop with these! Haven't had any trouble with flushing them, and they are sturdy enough to let dry and reuse if the diaper is just wet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mengers

product_meta.title: OsoCozy Flushable Diaper Liners - Make Cloth Diapering Convenient with Easy, Quick, Cloth Diaper Liners - Super Soft and Gentle on Baby’s Skin
product_meta.description:
Isn’t it time you tried soft, fuss-free and friendly diaper liners? OsoCozy Flushable Diaper Liners are your quick and convenient dream come true for cloth diaper care. Easy to use, just place a liner in the diaper, and flush away when dirty. No more awkwardly rinsing or scraping solids into the toilet! 

Our stay-dry, one-way diaper liners allow moisture to pass through to the diaper while retaining solids - a smart and simple way to keep baby more comfortable, minimize cloth diaper stains and make laundering easier. OsoCozy Flushable Diaper Liners are made of 100% viscose rayon manufactured from natural renewable resources, in a thickness that offers strength and minimal environmental impact. Contains no odors or chemical residues.

One order of OsoCozy Flushable Diaper Liners includes one roll with 100 perforated diaper liner sheets sized just under 8 x 12” (20 x 30 cm). Just tear, place, use and flush away. Liners are great for any size of any type of cloth diaper and can be folded to fit smaller diapers if needed. Septic tanks and older plumbing systems may require you let soiled liners soak in the bowl a bit before flushing to avoid clogging or damage.
feature_bullets: FLUSHABLE DIAPER LINERS - Isn’t it time you tried soft, fuss-free and eco-friendly diaper liners? OsoCozy Flushable Diaper Liners are your quick and convenient dream come true for cloth diaper care.

EASY TO USE - Just place a liner in the diaper, and flush away when dirty. No more awkwardly rinsing or scraping solids into the toilet! Septic tanks and older plumbing systems may require you let soiled liners soak in the bowl a bit before flushing to avoid clogging or damage.

SMART AND COMFORTABLE - Our stay-dry, one-way diaper liners allow moisture to pass through to the diaper while retaining solids - a smart and simple way to keep baby more comfortable, minimize cloth diaper stains and make laundering easier.

ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY - OsoCozy Flushable Diaper Liners are made of 100% viscose rayon manufactured from natural renewable resources, in a thickness that offers strength and minimal environmental impact. Contains no odors or chemical residues.

PERFORATED FOR CONVENIENCE - One order includes one roll with 100 perforated diaper liner sheets sized just under 8 x 12” (20 x 30 cm). Great for any size of any type of cloth diaper and can be folded to fit smaller diapers if needed.
